programmes.show_description: Romance: Lee Mack's Rose d'Or-winning comedy returns - and it's now a family sitcom, as Lee and Lucy have three kids in tow. The married pair try to keep the romance alive.
Babysitting: Comedy great Bobby Ball returns in Lee Mack's puntastic sitcom. Lee's dad Frank babysits the kids, which Lucy regrets when young Benji repeats a swear word.
Car: Pun-lovers rejoice for the return of Lee Mack's hit sitcom. Lee hopes for a stress-free ferry trip to France, but when you've got kids, things tend not to go to plan...
Ruff & Reddy: Sandi Toksvig looks at ruffs and red things with Alan Davies, Tom Allen, Susan Calman and Zoe Lyons.
Lucy breaks into the big time after her BAFTA nomination as UKTV want a proper A-list comedy name on the couple's show and are ready to splash the cash, but Jon has other ideas.
Lucy has a nightmare on Bake Off and Gregg Wallace isn't having it, Jon has a real nightmare and Lucy makes the most of it, and UKTV want Jon and Gill to be their new star double act.
Lucy makes her mark on Taskmaster but finds out that Julian Clary is a dangerous man to know, and Jon helps Elsie win more house points but risks a sticky end to his meddling.
Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis feature in a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring fond favourites, outtakes, and other previously unseen bits.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.

programmes.show_name: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programmes.show_description: A Physically Large Head: Mirthful musings on life with the laptop-literate comedian. Dave ponders society's image obsession and investigates how far people will go for fame.
Perth: Auction experts compete for storage lots in the cut-throat reality show! The chance of winning a car in a blind auction drives Heavy D and the gang into a bidding frenzy.
Blackpool: Fast-talking auctioneer Sean Kelly brings his hugely popular show over the pond. The gang visit Blackpool, where Nat and John take a punt on a novel mode of transport.
Bob and Paul travel to the northern islands of Norway on an extreme fishing adventure as they face the mighty maelstrom where tides collide and big fish await.
Mountain Rescue Dog Handler: Guy loves dogs - he therefore jumps at the opportunity to become part of a dog mountain rescue team tackling dangerous terrain as a mountain rescue guide.
The team find out if you can grab a reliable used car for less than 500 pounds with the help of a tank assault course, and Chris lives the high life in Maserati's new MC20 supercar.
Freddie, Chris and Paddy celebrate 100 years of the BBC by tackling motorsport 1920s-style. Paddy delves into BMW's legendary M-cars, and Chris gets to grips with Ford's new WRC racer.
Comedians Jen Brister and Ian Moore, actor Kelvin Fletcher, and Dr Zoe Williams join the genial giant of quiz to test their general knowledge skills.
Comedians Jen Brister and Ian Moore, actor Kelvin Fletcher, and Dr Zoe Williams join the genial giant of quiz to test their general knowledge skills.
Breakfast: The Hairy Bikers look for great ways to kick start the day. They find out about how our morning meal has changed and evolved through the years.
Nation of Gardeners: The bikers celebrate British food. They head into the garden, where through good times and bad our skills have inspired amazing dishes.
Simon Reeve travels from the Peloponnese peninsula to the rugged and mountainous north of the country and learns how its people cope with seemingly never-ending crises.
Simon Reeve's journey around Turkey begins at Istanbul and the beaches of the Aegean Sea before ending up at the war-torn border with Syria.
Bob and Paul travel to the northern islands of Norway on an extreme fishing adventure as they face the mighty maelstrom where tides collide and big fish await.
Hobbies: Will and Ralf take hobby-hunting to extremes with ice-cold swims, full-frontal art classes, and cosplaying as cowboys in the most unlikely of places.

programmes.show_name: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programmes.show_description: New. Roy Wood Jr is host as comedian and actor Guz Khan - and broadcaster Kirsty Wark - join team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the news.
Ruff & Reddy: Sandi Toksvig looks at ruffs and red things with Alan Davies, Tom Allen, Susan Calman and Zoe Lyons.
Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis feature in a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring fond favourites, outtakes, and other previously unseen bits.
Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis look back at some of the news from the recent past with guests Angela Barnes, Alasdair Beckett-King, Rhys James, Ria Lina and Josh Pugh.
More cutting-edge stand-up from the iconic theatre in London. The hilarious Loyiso Gola hosts and welcomes comedians Scott Bennett and Helen Bauer to the stage.
Green: Witty quiz. Stephen Fry urges Jeremy Clarkson, Bill Bailey, Danny Baker and Alan Davies to eat their greens - and their words - as he entraps them with commonly confused facts.
Milk Money: Another return to the town with a funny heart. Johnny gets thrown into the raw milk business, Moira tries to connect with the townspeople, and David gives style advice.
Moira's Nudes: A scandalous edition of the hit sitcom. Moira is worried that racy photos from her past will jeopardise her campaign, Johnny asks for financial help, and Alexis gets a job.
Ronnie's Party: Raise the roof with the global smash-hit sitcom. Johnny and Moira meet a key demographic, Alexis struggles with her new job, and David offers support to his boss' daughter.
The Motel Guest: Check in for another update on the absurd antics of the Rose clan. Johnny and Moira contend with a surprise guest, and Alexis and David look for a flat.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
Freddie Flintoff hosts as 24 waterlogged contestants get ready for a full-on faceplant in the Med when they take on the skimmer, the blob, and an incredibly fast slide....
Officers find a man-made compartment within the trailer of a truck returning Stateside, and two Americans arouse suspicions with an unsafe lane change at the US-Canada border.
Officers at Eagle Pass intercept a driver smuggling narcotics over the border, and a group of passengers in Laredo refuse to admit to owning an air compressor full of rifles.
Truck Rescue: Guy joins a multi-generational family business who rescue crashed or broken-down HGVs as he learns the physics of truck recovery and operates a crane during a complex rescue.
Rick samples the tastes in the area famed for El Cid and its classic landscape of castles and vast plains, then it's off to La Mancha, the hot dry heart of Spain.
A Cuban woman crosses the bridge in the hope of being granted political asylum in America, while officers in Laredo stop three students carrying something unusual in their car.
Customs and Border Protection officers are stunned when they discover more than $2million of cocaine mixed in with gallons of household paint and bottles of beer.
Iceland: Ed Gamble and Lou Sanders have been friends for years, so much so that she's bought a 'his 'n' hers' set of driving gloves to tackle a dangerous 1,000 kilometres of Iceland.
The lads face a trucking nightmare as they try to become HGV drivers - Jeremy also tries out a scary Porsche 911, and Michael Parkinson is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.
Hi-jinks with Clarkson, Hammond and May. Jeremy, Richard and James take three muscle cars on an epic US road trip, and Will Young is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.
Royal Family: The fabulous biker boys go on a journey through time to celebrate British food. They start by exploring the culinary influence of the monarchy.
Rick samples the tastes in the area famed for El Cid and its classic landscape of castles and vast plains, then it's off to La Mancha, the hot dry heart of Spain.
Rob Brydon is back in the host's chair of the comedy panel show - the guests joining Lee Mack and David Mitchell this time are Gabby Logan, Chris McCausland, Angela Scanlon and John Simm.
The best-selling writer and Pointless regular invites comedians Jayde Adams and Rufus Hound, TV presenter Josie d'Arby, and radio DJ Scott Mills to test their general knowledge skills.
Not-so-Pointless quizzing action with Mark Billingham, Neil Delamere, AJ Odudu and Lucy Porter, who are all invited to test their general knowledge skills in this edition.

programmes.show_description: Personal Challenges: Will and Ralf push each other out of their comfort zones as Ralf takes a nervous Will back to school while Will challenges Ralf to a gruelling uphill tandem ride. S2 Ep
